name: Harbhara (Chickpea)
description: Premium quality organic chickpeas grown using traditional farming methods. Rich in protein and fiber, our chickpeas are perfect for a variety of dishes.
farmingMethod: Organic farming with natural composting and crop rotation. No chemical pesticides or synthetic fertilizers used.

name: Tur (Pigeon Pea)
description: Nutritious pigeon peas cultivated with care on our organic farm. A staple in Indian cuisine, known for its rich taste and nutritional value.
farmingMethod: Sustainable farming practices with natural pest control and organic manure. Grown in well-drained soil with adequate sunlight.

name: Soyabean
description: High-quality organic soybeans packed with protein and essential nutrients. Ideal for oil extraction and various food products.
farmingMethod: Organic cultivation with nitrogen-fixing properties that enrich soil naturally. Grown without GMO seeds.

name: Kapas (Cotton)
description: Premium organic cotton grown sustainably on our farm. Used for textile production and oil extraction from seeds.
farmingMethod: Organic cotton farming with integrated pest management. Water-efficient irrigation methods and natural fertilizers.

name: Onion
description: Fresh, organically grown onions with a perfect balance of sweetness and pungency. Essential ingredient for countless dishes.
farmingMethod: Organic farming with well-drained soil and proper spacing. Natural pest control and organic compost used.

name: Kakdi (Cucumber)
description: Crisp and refreshing organic cucumbers grown in our farm. Perfect for salads, pickles, and healthy snacking.
farmingMethod: Organic cultivation with trellis support system. Regular watering and natural pest management.
benefits: Rich in vitamins K and C

name: Methi (Fenugreek)
description: Aromatic and nutritious fenugreek leaves grown organically. Both leaves and seeds are used in cooking and traditional medicine.
farmingMethod: Organic farming with cool season cultivation. Grown in well-drained soil with organic matter.
harvestTime: 20-30 days for leaves, 90-100 days for seeds

name: Sambhar Vegetables
description: A fresh mix of traditional vegetables perfect for sambhar - including drumsticks, brinjal, tomatoes, and more. Grown organically on our farm.
farmingMethod: Mixed organic vegetable farming with companion planting. Natural pest control and crop rotation practiced.
